When we model peaceful and loving relati: When we model peaceful and loving relationships, our children feel more secure and loved. Positive language, active listening, empathy help maintain a peaceful and happy family environment these stressful times.
We are models for our kids.
How we talk and behave in front of other: How we talk and behave in front of others is a big influence on how they behave too!
Try to talk kindly to everyone in the fa: Try to talk kindly to everyone in the family, adults and children.
Bad communication between adults in the: Bad communication between adults in the household can have a negative impact on our children.
The more we practise modelling peaceful,: The more we practise modelling peaceful, loving relationships for our children the more secure and loved they will feel.
Looking after children and other family: Looking after children and other family members is difficult, but it's much easier when responsibilities are shared.
Try to share households chores, childcar: Try to share households chores, childcare and other tasks equally amongst family members.
Create a schedule for time \"on\" and ti: Create a schedule for time "on" and time "off" with other adults in your household.
It is okay to ask for help when you are: It is okay to ask for help when you are feeling tired or stressed so that you can take a break.
Give yourself a 10-second pause. Breathe: Give yourself a 10-second pause. Breathe in and out slowly five minutes. Then try to respond in a calmer way. Millions of parents say this helps -A LOT
Call a truce when you can see arguments: Call a truce when you can see arguments building up, and go into anther room or outside if you can
See tip sheets on \"When we Get Angry\": See tip sheets on "When we Get Angry" and "Keep calm and Manage stress"
Tell others what you want them to do ins: Tell others what you want them to do instead of what you don't want them to do: instead of "Stop shouting," try "Please speak more quietly"
Praise makes others feel appreciated and: Praise makes others feel appreciated and good bout themselves. Simple words like, "Thank you for clearing the dinner," or "Thank you for watching the baby" can make a big difference
Nice things to do together as a family: Nice things to do together as a family
Let each family member take turns to cho: Let each family member take turns to choose a whole-family activity each day
Find ways to spend quality time with you: Find ways to spend quality time with your partner and other adults in your home, too!
Listen to others when they are talking w: Listen to others when they are talking with you
Be open and show them that you hear what: Be open and show them that you hear what they are saying
It can help to even summarise what you h: It can help to even summarise what you have heard before responding: "What I hear you saying is..."
